title: Margin focus pushes Indian IT firms away from subcontractors
description: In FY24, subcontracting costs hit their lowest levels in years: TCS at 6.20% of its revenue (the lowest since FY16), Infosys at 7.70% (lowest since FY21), Wipro at 11.50% (lowest since FY16), and Tech Mahindra at 12.60% (lowest since FY19), according to company data.
content: India’s leading IT companies have slashed their subcontracting costs — or, spending on high-cost temporary workforce — to multi-year lows, driven by increased focus on margins, cost optimisation, and enhancing internal capabilities.
